titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the James Burnham Papers, 1928-1983
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Rebecca J. Mead; machine-readable finding aid created by Xiuzhi Zhou

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-03-27T16:58-0700

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, notes, memoranda, and printed matter, relating to communism in the United States and abroad, the Congress for Cultural Freedom and other anti-communist movements in the United States and abroad, political conditions in the United States and the world, and conservative political thought.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James Burnham Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1988.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Professor of Philosophy, New York University
Co-author (with Philip Wheelwright), Introduction to Philosophical Analysis
Author, The Struggle for the World
Author, The Case for De Gaulle (with Andre Malraux)
Author, The Coming Defeat of Communism
Author, Congress and the American Tradition
Author, The War We Are In

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, legal documents, clippings and other printed material, reports, and miscellany; includes material relating to James Burnham's work, employment, financial matters, health, family, and art collecting.

did.unittitle: General. Correspondence, legal documents, printed material, and miscellany; includes material relating to employment, financial matters, health, family, and art collecting
Analyses. Clippings, correspondence, and reports relating to James Burnham's work,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript and printed copies, serial issues, notes, reviews, memoranda, correspondence, and legal documents. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: General. Unidentified fragments, outlines, and typescripts,
Letters to editors. Correspondence, typescripts, and printed copies,
Reviews. By James Burnham of works by others,
Statement on communism in education, Typescript and notes
Symposium, Correspondence and contracts, 1964-1977. Primarily relates to an agreement to reprint specific volumes, 1964-1977

General. Clippings, typescript drafts of introductions to several foreign language editions, and material relating to a review of the book by George Orwell, including a copy of the review, and James Burnham's letter to the editor in response,
"What Future for Free Enterprise?" Town Meeting, Printed copy and letter
The Machiavellians, 1943. Clipping, preface to subsequent edition, and correspondence (with Henry Regnery and others),
"Is Russia Aiming at Post-War Domination of Europe?" Correspondence and a printed copy of a debate with Ely Culbertson
"The Sixth Turn of the Communist Screw," Partisan Review, Printed copy
"Stalin and the Junkers," Commonweal, Printed copy
General. Review and a printed copy of a chapter excerpt entitled, "The Goal of Soviet Policy," American Mercury,
"What is the Purpose of the United Nations?" Annals of the American Academy, Printed copy, correspondence, and clipping, 1947-1948
The Case for De Gaulle, 1948 (with Andre Malraux). Correspondence,
"How the United Nations Can be Made to Work," Reader's Digest, Correspondence, 1948
"The Strategy of the Politburo and the Problem of American Counter-Strategy," Letter, reports, and typescripts
The Coming Defeat of Communism, 1950. Reviews, typescripts, printed copy of an excerpt (in Japanese), and correspondence,
"What Can We Expect of Europe?" American Mercury, Letters, 1950
"Why Communism Will Fail," This Week, Letters, 1950
Article on psychological warfare, 1950-1951. Typescripts, memorandum, and correspondence (Paul Palmer, Reader's Digest),
Statements, Congress for Cultural Freedom, Typescripts and clipping
"Parakeets and Parchesi: An Indian Memorandum," Partisan Review, Printed copy
"The Humanities and the Law," New York University Law Review, Printed copy
"Philosophy of Communism," Naval War College Review, Printed copy
Essay on foreign affairs, Partisan Review, Printed copy
"The Case Against Adlai Stevenson," American Mercury, Printed copy and correspondence (with Sidney Hook, Arthur Schlesinger, Jr., and others)
"How Long Will the Cold War Last?" Banking, Printed copy
What Europe Thinks of America (James Burnham, editor), Correspondence (Sylvain Troeder, Joseph Czapski, Raymond Aron, and others), and contract, 1953

Containment or Liberation? 1953. Reviews, correspondence (with H.V. Kaltenborn, Raymond Moley, and others), a broadcast transcript, and printed articles excerpted from the book entitled, "The East European Strategy," Ukrainian Quarterly, and "The Primacy of Politics," "Can Washington Conduct Political Warfare?", and "The Policy of Liberation," American Mercury,
"Can America Liberate the World?" This Week, Printed copy and correspondence
"Why Containment Must Go," New Leader, Printed copy
Column on death of Stalin, Freeman, Printed copy
"What Will Happen to the Jews Behind the Iron Curtain?" National Jewish Monthly, Printed copy
"Was Bohlen a Blunder?" Freeman, Printed copy
" The Commonweal and McCarthyism," Commonweal, Printed copy
Web of Subversion, 1954. Reviews, correspondence (with Paul Palmer, Benjamin Mandel, and others), memorandum (House Un-American Activities Committee), chart, and receipts,
"Do Europeans Really Hate Us?" This Week, Correspondence
"Tribunes of the People," Freeman, Printed copies
"Kommunistische Unterwuhlung der Vereinigten Staaten," Schweizer Monatshefte, Printed copy and letter, 1955-1962
"Why Not Investigate the Court?" National Review, Printed copy
Congress and the American Tradition, 1959. Correspondence (with Henry Regnery and others), contract, reviews, notes, outlines, typescripts, and printed material,
"ADA: Our Number One Lobby," 1963. Correspondence (with Eugene Lyons, Benjamin Mandel, and others), typescript, printed material, and notes,
The Suicide of the West, 1964. Correspondence (with Irving Kristol and others), notes, outlines, miscellany, clippings, articles, and other background material, reviews, and miscellany,
"What's Wrong with the Cold War?" Typescript and correspondence
"Let Us Stand Firm in Vietnam," Letter and typescript apparently prepared for Senator Thomas Dodd
Statements on Vietnam, Typescript and correspondence

"Analysis of USIA: Program Books for Overseas Use," 1969. Correspondence (with Frank Shakespeare, Karl Baarslag, and others), clippings, memoranda, outlines, typescript, printed material, book lists, reviews, and other background material,
Memorandum of conversation with Juan Carlos of Spain, Typescript

odd.head: General note
odd.p: NOTE: The bulk of this material relates generally to James Burnham's writings and political ideas; most correspondence relating to specific works is located in the SPEECHES AND WRITINGS series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters, biographical material, reports, memoranda, printed material, and miscellany. The bulk of this material relates generally to James Burnham's writings and political ideas, while most of the correspondence relating to specific works is located in the SPEECHES AND WRITINGS series. Includes correspondence neither to nor from James Burnham. Arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Apert, Daniel, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Congress for Cultural Freedom
Baczkowski, Wlodzimierz, Includes biographical sketches, and a report entitled "The National and Racial Minorities of Soviet Russia"
Buckley, James, Includes a memorandum on the SST and a typescript speech entitled, "What Americans Can Learn from Israel"
Chang, Carsun, Includes correspondence with Chou Hsiang-kuang
De Courcy, Kenneth, Includes a letter and clipping relating to Kenneth De Courcy
Eastman, Max, Relates to Max Eastman's condensation of two of James Burnham's books
Hunt, E. Howard, Includes curriculum vita
Masani, Minoo R., Includes material relating to the Congress for Cultural Freedom
Mayence Research Associates (M.B. Somerfield, Director), Includes memoranda relating to inquiries about this organization
Nabokov, Nicholas, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Congress for Cultural Freedom
Percy, Charles H., Includes a memorandum by James Burnham relating to foreign policy positions in the Republican Party platform
Pound, Ezra, Includes cover letter from Henry Regnery
Schiff, Sydney, Includes correspondence between Schiff and David Burnham, and between James Burnham and individuals interested in the Schiff papers
United States Air Force, Air War College,
Woolf, Virginia, Letter to unidentified correspondent
Young, Arthur, Includes reports and printed material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, newsletters, clippings, articles, pamphlets, and other printed material, lists, financial material, notes, transcripts, program statements, press releases, biographical material, and miscellany. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Correspondence, notes, biographical material, and miscellany, ; includes material relating to trade, Latin America, and the United Nations

Africa. Correspondence (with Boris Souvarine, Eugene Lyons, Pedro T. Pereira, Portuguese Ambassador to the U.S., and others), clippings, reports, notes, and newsletters (Kenneth De Courcy), ; includes material relating to Rhodesia, South Africa, and Russian influence in Africa

American Committee for Cultural Freedom. Correspondence (with Irving Kristol, Ralph De Toldedano, Albert Einstein, Sidney Hook, M.R. Masani, Arthur Koestler, Nicholas Nabokov, Irving Brown, Elliott Cohen, and others), financial statements, flyer, list, and reports (including material relating to immigration and the McCarran Act),

Communism and anti-communism. Correspondence, memoranda, reports, bibliographies, conference material, report (Karl Wittfogel), bulletin (Socialist Party Convention, 1937), printed article (Boris Souvarine), and a program statement ("Theses of the Fourth Comintern Congress on the Negro Question"). Primarily correspondence (research inquiries) relating to James Burnham's participation in American Trotskyite organizations, ; also includes material relating to Milton Sacks
Congress for Cultural Freedom. Includes material relating to conferences in Berlin and New Delhi, the International Exposition of the Arts (Paris, and the establishment of a Japanese committee
Correspondence. Daniel Apert, Arnold Beichman, Nicholas Nabokov, Louis Gibarti, Melvin Lasky, German Arciniegas, and others,
Non-printed material. Lists of delegates, reports, memoranda, speech notes, receipts, programs, and notes,
Printed material. Clippings, printed article, pamphlets, program; includes material by Melvin Lasky and Denis de Rougemont,
Davies, John Paton. Biographical material, correspondence (with Lyle Munson and others), letters to editors (Edgar Snow and James Burnham), and a broadcast transcript,

Defense and atomic weapons. Letter to the editor, minutes, memoranda, biographical material, article, and correspondence (Lawrence Hafsted and others), ; includes material relating to J. Robert Oppenheimer, and to the deaths of Paul P. Stoutenburgh and family
Europe. Correspondence, biographical material, memoranda, and reports, ; includes material relating to Greece, post-World War II Germany, Eastern Europe, and France

Free Europe University (affiliated with the National Committee for a Free Europe, Inc.). SEE ALSO: Institut Litteraire ( Kultura)/Correspondence/Giedroyc, Jerzy. Primarily correspondence (with A.A. Berle, Jr., DeWitt Poole, Levering Tyson, Malcolm W. Davis, Lev Dobriansky, Anatol Muhlstein, and Boleslaw Wierzbianski); also includes memoranda, reports, draft press release, biographical material, and a clipping,

General. Notes, program proposals, financial material, report, printed material, and biographical material, ; includes material relating to the Free Europe University and the Congress for Cultural Freedom

General. Marvin Liebman, Zygmunt Nagorski, Lilly Endowment, Relm Foundation, Clarence Manion, Hobart Lewis, and others, ; primarily relates to fund-raising efforts in conjunction with the Polish Institute of Arts and Sciences in America and the World Youth Crusade for Freedom
Lattimore, Owen. Reports by Owen Lattimore from Prague (1947), correspondence, printed material, subpoena (House Un-American Activities Committee), and statements (Pat McCarran),

Milosz, Czeslaw. Corresopndence (with Jacques Maritain, Albert Einstein, and others), poem, memorandum, bibliography, typescripts, and affidavits (from James Burnham, Jerzy Giedroyc, Joseph Czapski, Sidney Hook, Nicholas Nabokov, and others), ; relates to efforts to obtain a U.S. entry visa
General. Memoranda, notes, financial material, pamphlet, and circular, ; SEE ALSO: CORRESPONDENCE FILE/Buckley, William F. and Kendall, Willmoore
Pauling v. National Review. Correspondence (with C. Dickerman Williams, G. Albertini, Stephen Hugh-Jones, and others), pamphlet, and notes for testimony by James Burnham,
Organisation de l'Armee Secrete "Charlesmagne". Correspondence (Jean Parvulesco) and program statements (in French),
Russia. Correspondence, notes, and printed material,
United States - Politics. Correspondence, and reports, ; includes material relating to Barry Goldwater

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: See photo card catalog for description

did.unittitle: 2 prints of Czech students carrying a wreath in the funeral procession of Jan Palach, 1969; 4 prints of a villa in Greece (?), undated; 5 prints of Suzette and Enrique Ellinger, 1943; 1 print of Mrs. Burnham(?), undated; 1 group photograph from the Public Affairs Conference on Foreign Aid, January 1962
